header: update 1-jp morgan cuts european chemical cos 2009 earnings view
body:
Oct 24 (Reuters) - J.P. Morgan Securities cut its 2009 earnings outlook for European chemical companies by an average of 13 percent, and downgraded four stocks in the sector, citing a significantly weaker demand in developed markets and slower growth in emerging markets.

The brokerage said it expects a destocking cycle to magnify volume weakness as early as third quarter of 2008, driven by an uncertain demand outlook, sharply falling oil price and tightening credit coupled with a need to conserve cash.

JP Morgan said while fundamental value now exists for the sector as a recent sell off has opened up good longer-term valuation opportunities, it expects “value to continue to take a back seat, in favour of earnings security and visibility.”

The brokerage downgraded BASF BASF.DE and Lanxess (LXSG.DE) to “neutral” from “overweight” and Akzo Nobel NV (AKZO.AS) and DSM (DSMN.AS) to “underweight” from “neutral.”

However, it raised Syngenta SYNN.VX to “overweight” from “neutral” on reassuring strong third-quarter sales.

The following table lists the price target changes -

* Swiss francs (Reporting by Jose Kottanani in Bangalore; Editing by Himani Sarkar)
